title: Impulse - 40 and 50 kg students on chairs

content.question: A <math alttext="50 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>50</mn><mtext>-kg</mtext></math> student sitting in a rolling chair at rest pushes against a wall, which applies a <math alttext="10 newton second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N·s</mtext></math> horizontal impulse to the student. Later, a <math alttext="40 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>40</mn><mtext>-kg</mtext></math> student is at rest in the same rolling chair and catches a <math alttext="10 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn><mtext>-kg</mtext></math> ball while applying a <math alttext="10 newton second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N·s</mtext></math> horizontal impulse to the ball. Which of the following statements best describes the students’ final speeds and provides valid reasoning supporting the claim?

choices.label: Both students have the same final speed because the <math alttext="50 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>50</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></math> student-chair system and the <math alttext="10 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></math> ball-<math alttext="40 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>40</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></math> student-chair system have the same mass and experience impulses of the same magnitude.
Both students have the same final speed because each ball-chair-student system experiences the same impulse regardless of the mass of the system.

The <math alttext="40 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>40</mn><mtext>-kg</mtext></math> student has a greater final speed because the <math alttext="40 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>40</mn><mtext>-kg</mtext></math> student-chair system has less mass than the <math alttext="50 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>50</mn><mtext>-kg</mtext></math> student-chair system.

The <math alttext="40 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>40</mn><mtext>-kg</mtext></math> student has a greater final speed because the ball transfers all of its momentum to the student when it is caught.

content.answer: The <math alttext="40 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>40</mn><mtext>-kg</mtext></math> student has a greater final speed because the <math alttext="40 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>40</mn><mtext>-kg</mtext></math> student-chair system has less mass than the <math alttext="50 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>50</mn><mtext>-kg</mtext></math> student-chair system.
